verses.verse: Now it happened in the fourteenth<WH702> year<WH8141> of king<WH4428> Hezekiah,<WH2396> that Sennacherib<WH5576> king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> attacked<WH5927> all of the fortified<WH1219> cities<WH5892> of Judah,<WH3063> and captured them.<WH8610>

The king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> sent<WH7971> Rabshakeh<WH7262> from Lachish<WH3923> to Jerusalem<WH3389> to king<WH4428> Hezekiah<WH2396> with a large<WH3515> army.<WH2426> He stood<WH5975> by the aqueduct<WH8585> from the upper<WH5945> pool<WH1295> in the fuller<WH3526>'s field<WH7704> highway.<WH4546>

Then Eliakim<WH471> the son<WH1121> of Hilkiah,<WH2518> who was over the household,<WH1004> and Shebna<WH7644> the scribe,<WH5608> and Joah,<WH3098> the son<WH1121> of Asaph,<WH623> the recorder<WH2142> came out to him.<WH3318>

Rabshakeh<WH7262> said<WH559> to them,<WH559> "Now tell Hezekiah,<WH2396> <WH559> 'Thus says the great<WH1419> king,<WH4428> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> "What confidence<WH986> is this in which you trust?<WH986>
I say<WH559> that your counsel<WH6098> and strength<WH1369> for the war<WH4421> are only vain<WH8193> words.<WH1697> Now in whom do you trust,<WH982> that you have rebelled against me?<WH4775>

Behold,<WH982> you trust in the staff<WH4938> of this bruised<WH7533> reed,<WH7070> even in Egypt,<WH4714> which if a man<WH376> leans<WH5564> on it,<WH935> it will go into his hand<WH3709> and pierce<WH5344> it.<WH6547> So is Pharaoh king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> to all who trust in him.<WH982>

But if you tell<WH559> me,<WH982> 'We trust in Yahweh<WH3068> our God,<WH430>' isn't<WH1116> that he whose high places and whose altars<WH4196> Hezekiah<WH2396> has taken away,<WH5493> and has said<WH559> to Judah<WH3063> and to Jerusalem,<WH3389> <WH7812> 'You shall worship before<WH6440> this altar?<WH4196>'"

Now therefore,<WH6148> please make a pledge to my master<WH113> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> and I will give<WH5414> you two thousand<WH505> horses,<WH5483> if you are able<WH3201> on your part to set<WH5414> riders on them.<WH7392>

How then can you turn away<WH7725> the face<WH6440> of one<WH259> captain<WH6346> of the least<WH6996> of my master<WH113>'s servants,<WH5650> and put your trust<WH982> on Egypt<WH4714> for chariots<WH7393> and for horsemen?<WH6571>

Have I come up<WH5927> now without<WH1107> Yahweh<WH3068> against this land<WH776> to destroy<WH7843> it?<WH3068> Yahweh said<WH559> to me,<WH5927> "Go up against this land,<WH776> and destroy it.<WH7843>"'"

Then Eliakim,<WH471> Shebna<WH7644> and Joah<WH3098> said<WH559> to Rabshakeh,<WH7262> "Please speak<WH1696> to your servants<WH5650> in Aramaic,<WH762> for we understand<WH8085> it;<WH1696> and don't speak to us in the Jews<WH3066>' language in the hearing<WH241> of the people<WH5971> who are on the wall.<WH2346>"

But Rabshakeh<WH7262> said,<WH559> "Has my master<WH113> sent<WH7971> me only to your master<WH113> and to you,<WH1696> to speak these words,<WH1697> and not to the men<WH582> who sit<WH3427> on the wall,<WH2346> who will eat<WH398> their own dung<WH2716> and drink<WH8354> their own urine with you?<WH7272>"

Then Rabshakeh<WH7262> stood,<WH5975> and called<WH7121> out with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963> in the Jews<WH3066>' language, and said,<WH559> "Hear<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of the great<WH1419> king,<WH4428> the king<WH4428> of Assyria!<WH804>
Thus says<WH559> the king,<WH4428> <WH2396> 'Don't let Hezekiah deceive<WH5377> you;<WH3201> for he will not be able to deliver you.<WH5337>

Don't<WH2396> let Hezekiah make you trust<WH982> in Yahweh,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> "Yahweh<WH3068> will surely<WH5337> deliver<WH5337> us.<WH5892> This city won't<WH5414> be given into the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria.<WH804>"'

Don't<WH8085> listen to Hezekiah,<WH2396> for thus says<WH559> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> <WH6213> 'Make your peace<WH1293> with me,<WH3318> and come out to me;<WH376> and each of you eat<WH398> from his vine,<WH1612> and each one<WH376> from his fig tree,<WH8384> and each one<WH376> of you drink<WH8354> the waters<WH4325> of his own cistern;<WH953>
until I come<WH935> and take you away<WH3947> to a land<WH776> like your own land,<WH776> a land<WH776> of grain<WH1715> and new wine,<WH8492> a land<WH776> of bread<WH3899> and vineyards.<WH3754>

Beware lest Hezekiah<WH2396> persuade<WH5496> you,<WH559> saying, "Yahweh<WH3068> will deliver<WH5337> us.<WH376>" Have any of the gods<WH430> of the nations<WH1471> delivered<WH5337> their lands<WH776> from the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria?<WH804>
Where are the gods<WH430> of Hamath<WH2574> and Arpad?<WH774> Where are the gods<WH430> of Sepharvaim?<WH5617> Have they delivered<WH5337> Samaria<WH8111> from my hand?<WH3027>

Who are they among all the gods<WH430> of these countries<WH776> that have delivered<WH5337> their country<WH776> out of my hand,<WH3027> that Yahweh<WH3068> should deliver<WH5337> Jerusalem<WH3389> out of my hand?<WH3027>'"
But they remained silent,<WH2790> and said<WH6030> nothing<WH1697> in reply,<WH4428> for the king's commandment<WH4687> was,<WH559> "Don't<WH1697> answer him."

Then Eliakim<WH471> the son<WH1121> of Hilkiah,<WH2518> who was over the household,<WH1004> and Shebna<WH7644> the scribe,<WH5608> and Joah,<WH3098> the son<WH1121> of Asaph,<WH623> the recorder,<WH2142> came<WH935> to Hezekiah<WH2396> with their clothes<WH899> torn,<WH7167> and told<WH5046> him the words<WH1697> of Rabshakeh.<WH7262>
